result.execSummary:
The defendant Madison Bailey Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Madison Bailey Larson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Madison Bailey Larson was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
2 years authorized because allegation of domestic abuse related.
Concurrent with: Buffalo County Case No. 2016CM126.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DNA surcharge and domestic abuse surcharge according to schedule set up by Probation & Parole.

Provide a DNA sample.
No contact with DRS except for the purposes of child placement as authorized in a family court order entered after today.
Comply with any assessment or counseling set up by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 10 days jail with huber privileges.  May serve in Dunn County if at no cost to Pepin County.
Consecutive to: Buffalo County Case No. 2016CM126.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Madison Bailey Larson in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached defendant will plead to count 1, 2 yrs probation with condition: 10 days jail; any counseling requested by P&P, no contact with D.S. w/o agent approval.  State moves to dismiss count 2.  Defendant will also plead to Buffalo Co. matter 16CM126.  Atty Seifert has authority to do so.  Defendant consents to plead in Pepin County on his Buffalo Co. matter.  2 yrs probation because domestic abuse.    State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements.  Court advises of charge in count 1/max penalties, cannot possess firearm under federal law; advises defendant of charge in Buffalo Co. case count 1/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to Buffalo Co. case 16CM126; defendant enters plea of guilty to Pepin County case 16CM26 count 1.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Note Domestic Abuse related on JOC.  State informs no request for restitution; request 10 days jail on ea. case and 2 yrs probation in total; no contact with DRS be at agents discretion.  On each case, Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation; 2 yrs. authorized because allegation of domestic abuse related on each case; serve 10 days jail on each case in respective jails; serve at times not concurrent with eachother.  Defendant requests to serve in Dunn County.  Court orders may be served in Pepin Co. or Dunn Co. com. June 30th at 6 p.m. with huber privileges; report on Buffalo Co. case first and 1 day credit on Buffalo Co. case; report July 7 at 6 p.m. on Pepin Co. case; Provide a DNA sample on ea. case; stop at jail today; each case no contact with DRS except for purposes of child placement as authorized in a family court order entered after today; pay costs on ea. case including DA surcharge; pay according to schedule set up by P&P; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; advised of appeal rights.  Dismiss other Buffalo Co. D.C. case.  Dismiss count 2 in Pepin Co. case.
Motion hearing on May 30, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a for Motion Hearing.  Atty Hillestad to reschedule within the next 2 weeks and inform his client of new date/time.
Motion hearing on May 15, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on May 9, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Motion Re: Other Acts

ADDRESS INFO for Madison Bailey Larson
Current: E9037 Cty Rd N, Colfax, WI 54730 United States  (Effective: 04-04-2017)

Final pre-trial on June 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on July 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on July 18, 2017.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for June 26, 2017 at 9:00 a.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than May 4, 2017. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than May 4, 2017, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.
